archive.policy_name: Tool Call and User Interaction Restriction
archive.description: You should only make one tool call at a time, and if you make a tool call, you should not respond to the user simultaneously. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call at the same time.
references: You should only make one tool call at a time, and if you make a tool call, you should not respond to the user simultaneously.
If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call at the same time.
archive.comments:

The policy ensures sequential operations, which can be validated and are actionable as it mandates behavior rather than tool specifics. However, since it doesn't directly relate to the use of ToolX, it is not relevant or specific to this particular tool. The policy is clear enough and doesn't require additional context from the policy document. Score is derived from its clarity and enforceability but discounted for lack of relevance to ToolX.

archive.description: You should not provide any information, knowledge, or procedures not provided by the user or available tools.
references: You should not provide any information, knowledge, or procedures not provided by the user or available tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.
archive.comments:

However, it is too broad and applied to all tool usage rather than specifically targeting ToolX. It is actionable since the tool can enforce this by adhering strictly to the parameters provided or available in the system. The policy allows for actionable use of ToolX without needing additional context from the policy document. It is clear and complete within its scope.
